The a/c wasn'r working at its peak for such a hot day, but they did provide a high velocity floor fan that more than made up for it. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Close to Fenway You Can Smell the Hotdogs!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingToosome
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 3 hours before check in and much to our delight our room was ready! Staff was cherry and very helpful. Room was clean, quiet and certainly larger than any we'd ever had in NYC. Fenway a hop, skip and not even full jump from the hotel side door. Parking was reasonable considering an out-of-towner does NOT want to adventure through Boston streets/traffic and would prefer the subway which, by the way, was also close and convienient. Would definately recommend HoJo's to anyone coming to ballgame or doing some historic sight-seeing. BTW...Hotel bar was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “The people make the difference”
Reviews.Author: jmentis
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and also smelled that way. I thought the rate was a little high but the Red Sox were in town. What was I to expect. The convenience to the ballpark was great as well as the close proximity to all Boston has to offer. The best was the lady behind the desk. When we checked in 5 hours early, (after a 6 hour drive), she was able and willing to give us a room at that time. I wish I remembered her name to request she get a raise.

Reviews.Title: “No worries here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nativemainer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were attending a Red Sox/Yankees game. Location cannot be beat. From the time we left our room until we were sitting in our seats in Fenway was, at the most, ten minutes (walking from hotel). Staff is very pleasant and accomodating. Room was basic, but clean, and beds were very comfortable. Restaurant is very good, both for supper and breakfast. We did not have time to try the pool, but it looked OK. Clean and well kept up. Will stay here again when I am attending a game at Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Very Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: OAK2BOS
Reviews.Content: This is a great value in the heart of Boston. I was very happy to find a clean room, very clean and comfortable beds, and a clean bathroom with ample towels and toiletries. The staff is very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and accomodating. and they're good at their jobs. We felt safe walking the streets at night and loved the proximity to the ball park. At $20/day, the parking is a real bargain as well. In this part of Boston parking is either metered or restricted to residents. And on game days everything is at least $50. With a son in college nearby I'm sure we'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: doughboy71
Reviews.Content: we had to bring our son to Boston because he had a appointment we Dr. Black at Brigham& Womens hospital the staff on the front desk were very helpful & friendly & explained where every thing was & how to get to different places it would be an excellent place to stay if you wanted to go & see a ball game fenway is right there you don't have to worry about parking etc.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: MBCNY
Reviews.Content: We booked the HoJo hotel room because of its location. We went to Boston to see Paul McCartney and wanted a hotel w/in walking distance of Fenway. Fenway Park is literally in its backyard. Our expectations were not very high but the hotel proved to be perfectly suitable for our needs. After the show we were pleasantly surprised that the Chinese restaurant in the hotel was still serving dinner at 11 pm , and the food was pretty good. The hotel could use a little cosmetic work (okay maybe a lot) but the room was fine, the sheets were crisp, the bathroom was clean, and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched proximity to Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: qhill
Reviews.Content: Basic, but clean accommodations. The proximity to Fenway can't be matched (we had a great view of the park from our room). Hotel is non-smoking, but our room did have a stale nicotine odor (we were glad we packed air freshener). Small bathroom, but clean. There were only three bath towels provided for our party of four. We requested extra towels and pillows at front desk. They were delivered to our room within minutes. AC was turned to coldest setting when we arrived. However, the room was warm, not cool. Ventilation was poor and uneven. This was the one major negative for us. After reading the rave reviews here, we were eager to try the Chinese restaurant on premises. The food was mediocre at best. Server did not seem entirely familiar with menu, and tried to discourage us from ordering an appetizer because it would take "an extra ten minutes." However, restaurant manager/owner(?) was lovely and courteous. Prices were reasonable, and the portions, generous. We parked mere steps from the hotel entrance, for $20/day. We will stay here again when visiting Fenway. The location and convenience to the ballpark are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Could crawl to Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: quiltingbabe
Reviews.Content: Our room was very pleasant and you could have crawled to Fenway. No parking worries or trying to get away from the Park afterwards. Very pleasant staff and clean room

Reviews.Title: “Smoker's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjboisseau
Reviews.Content: We asked for a non-smoking room and was assurred that the hotel is smoke free. There was even a sign on the lobby door stating this. But the two rooms we were given stunk - even the hallways! We signed a nasty legal form upon check in that said if we smoked in the room we had to pay a $150 fine. However, the room we had must have had a party in it the night before. The staff happily let us change rooms. The second room was mildly better, but still had a strong smoke odor. The A/C was barely cirulating air but eventually got the temp down to 78 degrees by morning. On a positive note, the location was wonderful - right next to Fenway Park! The staff is polite and seem responsive, although they are unable to do anything about the odor or A/C. If you are a smoker, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Special night at Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: grammieknits
Reviews.Content: I recently retired after 28 years in education and as a retirement gift some of my co-workers gave me two tickets to a Red Sox game. Although I am an avid fan I have never been to Fenway Park. The Howard Johnson Inn at Fenway park was the perfect place to stay. It was easy to get to, check-in was quick and easy, parking was available on the premisis (additional $20 fee) and it was just steps away from the Ball Park. The Red Sox won the game, we walked back to the hotel, had a nice late night dinner at the attached restaurant, and a comfortable night's sleep, with no worries about driving through traffic. We will definitely use the Howard Johnson at Fenway Park the next time we go to a game.

Reviews.Title: “don't buy in to the hype”
Reviews.Author: xxonejunxx
Reviews.Content: the location of this place is pretty awesome. fenway is literally right next door. and many colleges are 2 minute driving distances from the hotel. but the problem was that it seems to be mislead by a sign that reads "hong kong" restaurant. so it threw me off guard since i thought it was a restaurant instead of a hotel. as soon as i walk in, i assumed that this place is pretty nice. the lobby is kept clean and such. also the lady on the front desk was pretty nice, even though it was 1 in the morning. the room itself was pretty cool, and the ac is pretty awesome as well. but then, there were couple problems we had. the outlets were insanely horrible bc there was 5 outlets, which 3 of them were hoooked on to by a lamp. so charging the phone and the laptop was an issue. secondly, there are 2 outlets that are COMPLETELY hidden and ghetto. it is directly behind the bed, so you physically have to move the bed in order to plug in your electrical device. one condition. you MUST put the bed back in place, if you don't, the cord will fall off and completely stop doing what ever it was doing. it took us a pretty long time to find that cord, i mean honestly, who has a cord BEHIND a bed?! also, we couldn't turn on the tv for good 30 minutes bc it was not connnected to a power. all teh cords were occupied by the lights, and there are only limited plugs in the room, which was .. really bad. the bathroom was pretty clean. the bed was okay. good blanket, but bad pillows. i suggest to bring you're own pillow for this hotel. oh.. and there's the tv. the tv .... is not GREAT. if you want crisp picture, its def. not it for you. its mainly used for sound. the tv screen seems to panic like crazy half the time. so it hurts your eyes for a minute. also, they must redo the walls. some parts of the room were peeling apart, and it did not look appealing. lastly, if you are looking for internet... this hotel's internet is pretty... bad. its worse than a dial up i believe even though it is a wifi. the connection gets lost every other minute, checking emails would take hours. oh. btw. one thing that threw me off was the breakfast. i remember seeing it on ads saying they serve free breakfast, but .. it obviously didn't. some chinese man kinda gave me a tone saying "no we have no free breakfast, you pay here and eat." so yea.. kinda disappointed. false ads are a disappointment. conclusion if you're gonna go watch a boston red sox game, go ahead, this might be the best cheap affordable hotel for you. cause you literally have to take 5 steps to get there. if you're gonna go to boston for college visits, dont come here. its awful. if you want free breakfast, dont come here. if you're willing to spend hours on the internet and watch tv to spend the day, no dont come here. so i recommend this place strictly, for red sox fans who will be going to the game.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient”
Reviews.Author: Therealtoni
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much closer than I imagined to Fenway Park. Plus, it was walking distance to the "T" which brings you to downtown Boston. I saw a gameat Fenway. It rained and it was a blessing to be about a block away from the hotel. I could hear the cheering and music of the stadium at my room. A traveler unfamiliar with Boston would find this very convenient and helpful to use as a base for visiting the area..

Reviews.Title: “HoJOs @ Fenway was way cool”
Reviews.Author: Trooper223
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson's Hotel at 1271 Boylston Street in Boston literally sits within arms reach of historic Fenway Park. It is an awesome location if you are into sports and particularly if you love Baseball as I do. Literally if you have a room in the back of the hotel you can watch the players arrive for a game right from your room. It was fun to just walk around the historic ball park too. The hotel itself is an older hotel and in need of some updating but on the other hand everything was clean, neat, safe, and in working order. The people at Howard Johnson's were all very professional, helpful and went out of their way to help in any way that they could. This was probably my 5th or 6th time staying at HoJos there at Fenway and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend Howard Johnson for any visiting Red Sox Fans”
Reviews.Author: BangorPeter
Reviews.Content: II stayed briefly at the Howard Johnsonâ€™s near Fenway. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Upon checking in the front desk staff noticed I have a cane and very generously suggested I stay on the ground level. Going to a Soxâ€™s game this is a must stay hotel. I not only would recommend this Howard Johnsons but also will stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “They say location is everything, this hotel proves it”
Reviews.Author: dragon600
Reviews.Content: The location to go to a sox game is unbeatable. I have two young children and didn't want to walk around the city or drive after the game. We could see Fenway from our room. The rooms are adequate, nothing really special, but for the the convenience it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay very friendly”
Reviews.Author: connieredsox
Reviews.Content: we love staying here every time we come to boston for the red sox games it is right across the st. and every one is very friendly we like franny at the front dest always knows us and will help us any way she can keep up the good work. "go sox"

Reviews.Title: “Convienent and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Candice87
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Howard Johnson hotel. I wanted to go to Boston for my birthday, so I chose to stay here because it was the most affordable place to stay in the area. It was also appealing because it was in walking distance of fenway park, lansdowne street, and other popular attractions. I was surprised to find how nice and clean the rooms were for such a cheap price. The beds were comfy and I slept very soundly at night. I was most impressed with how helpful and friendly the staff were. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in Boston for the best deal possible.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BlessedinTexas
Reviews.Content: Although the location to Fenway is a plus, this hotel is in need of major renovation. Number one priority is that they get new beds. These were REALLY bad. They also need new bedspreads, curtains and carpeting. The smell in the room and in the hallways was also not good. There was one girl at the front desk that smiled and was helpful. I think her name was Natalie. The rest seemed like they couldn't care less. On the plus side, the location is great for Fenway. The bathroom was clean and there was hot water. The man in charge of the Chinese restaurant for breakfast was very nice and they had good coffee. If the management would work on these other important issues, it could be a great place. But the last straw for us was on the second day there was the definite strong odor of marijuana wafting down the hallway as we walked with our 7-year-old grandson. I also heard other people commenting about this. We would not stay here again. There are other hotels not that far from Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Only if price matters”
Reviews.Author: Uconnhoopsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4th of July, rooms are old, peeling wall paper, stained ceilings, grouse carpeting and temp. contols in room missing. But the female working the front desk Saturday and Sunday morning really needs a lesson in HOSPITALITY. Spend the extra money and stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your travel dollars elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: VOR87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during a first-time visit to Boston. My husband chose this hotel based on proximity to Fenway, where we were going to attend a game, and price ($150). The proximity to Fenway is both good and bad. The park is located around the corner and down the block from the hotel. All of the rooms at the back of the hotel look out at the ball park. The downside is the noise that continues throughout the night. and as a previous reviewer said, there is a frat house element with drunken fans milling around. Thank goodness we kept our earplugs from our Jet Blue flight! The hotel is old and needs serious upgrading. The hallway, as well as the first room we were assigned, smelled of smoke, the mattresses, including the rollaway, lacked proper support, and the bathroom is small and the configeration is just odd. With competitive rates available through Travelzoo & Priceline at other area hotels, I would recommend considering other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Comes down to convenience versus comfort”
Reviews.Author: Steve_in_Calgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned to spend 4 nights in Boston to catch to Red Sox games, tour Fenway and enjoy Boston before heading to Cape Cod. I booked the HoJo because of the decent rate and the proximity to Fenway which would be convenient after night games. Based on the reviews here, I thought it would be a decent stay. We arrived around 7pm on June 6th after a long flight from Calgary AB with a stop in Toronto. We were given a room on the first floor at the back of the hotel. When I asked if a second floor room was available, I was told that that this was the last room. Although we were staying through June 10th, no suggestion was made that we could change rooms the next day. The windows in all the rooms are single pane. Any outside noise is barely muffled. When on the first floor, people having a discussion outside their car in the parking lot at 3am might as well have had it in your room. The bed in our room on June 6th must have bee 20 years old. After lying on the one side for 20 minutes, when I got up, there was a crater where I had been lying. It would disappear in about an hour. The bed was so uncomfortable and the noise from Fenway unmuffled by the single paned windows that I barely slept that night. My back is still recovering and I've been in constant pain for two weeks. My wife finally suggested that we sleep across the bed instead which provided marginal improvement. The next morning, we asked to change rooms to one with preferably a firmer mattress and the desk staff got into a long discussion before putting us into the "best room in the hotel". I almost changed hotels and, in hindsight, wish I had. Supposedly, these were newly renovated but I suggest they have only been repainted. The decor, furniture and bedding were exactly the same. The bed was slightly better, at least allowing for an OK sleep. The hot water took so long to come to the room that I called the front desk. Turns out you need to let the water run for 10 full minutes before any hot water will arrive. This is very "un-green". Whenever I dealt with the front desk staff, they always left me with the impression that they dislike their job and I was bothering them. They were polite and provided assistance but the occasional smile couldn't hurt. Conversely, all dealings with the housekeeping staff were very pleasant and helpful. Every night after games at Fenway, there is alot of noise from the cleanup crews. I do understand that this is out of the hotel's control but a whole new set of windows (to upgrade the single panes) would minimize the noise from this. What was unacceptable was having to sign a document that I could be evicted from my room without refund if I was disturbing the peace but then having to endure an entire night (I think it stopped around 4:30am) on June 9th of screaming, yelling and door slamming from my neighbours. I guess I should have called the front desk but we felt it would be safer to remain quiet. These rooms are right by the staircase by the front lobby desk. There is no way the front desk could not have heard the constant disturbance. If you are going to have guests sign a form like that, then enforce the stipulation for the benefit of all your guests. When I checked out the next day, the rate for the 1st night was correct but nights 2-4 were 25% higher. The staff were quick to correct the error. Other comments: - They might as well fill the pool with dirt. The algae on the sides gave you the distinct impression that your health would be compromised by swimming in it. - The restaurant was OK at breakfast - nothing to complain about but nothing to recommend either. In summary: - The front desk staff needs training on how to smile - ALL the mattresses need to be replaced - Noise minimizing windows would be helpful - Manage the unruly guests - Compliments to housekeeping

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: kayefa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location as it was close to the Red Sox Ball Park. My husband was unable to walk far due to foot injury so this worked out fine for us. We took a cab to and from hotel which was very convenient and reasonable. Staff was very nice and was able to assist us with our questions regarding restaurants and assistance with cab back to Boston Airport early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service, good value, and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stockz
Reviews.Content: I go periodically to Boston for a medical checkup. The Howard Johnson Inn at Fenway Park has the most competitive prices and the location is convenient to the medical complex. Timely shuttle service to the hospitals is available to customers. Although the facility could use a face lift, the staff at the front desk more than compensated for the aging quarters. The desk personnel printed out my boarding pass for the flight home, directed me to good restaurants within walking distance, and showed a personal interest in my well being and comfort. I am recommending The Fenway Holiday Inn to friends and will certainly stay there myself on future visits. Michael Van Dress

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Fenway with the guys or a girls' night out, stay. Otherwise, you should maybe keep looking.”
Reviews.Author: choolie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few girlfriends for a concert at Fenway at the end of May. [Disclaimer: I travel with this pack of girls a bunch, and yes we do usually stay at newer, more like Courtyard-type hotels and we like shopping, pampering and jacuzzis, so consider the source.] The good: You can't get closer to Fenway. It's right-there, and that goes a long way toward making this a value. But it's old, and smells like smoke in the room and halls and the outdoor pool is green and the room doors all slam, and since it's right at the park everyone was partying in the halls until the wee hours. So I wouldn't bring the kiddies in -- stay nearby in Cambridge instead. The partying didn't bother us, even with yelling from room to room at 3am. One of my girlfriends read these reviews and brought her own sleeping bag and pillow and slept on top of the covers-- turned out to be a bonus move because when we returned from the concert around midnight our room was 60 degrees and when we called the front desk about the heat we were informed that the whole hotel has no heat. (No apology-- just matter of fact.) Set your expectations to frat house with an awesome location and you'll be alright. Bonus- Chinese restaurant in the lobby is pretty good and open pretty late.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: KLA529
Reviews.Content: I made a list of a few pros and cons about this hotel: Pro#1: Location, location, location. The hotel's location can't be beat for games or events at Fenway Park. You literally walk out of the hotel, walk half a block, turn the corner, walk another half block, and there's the Gate B entrance to Fenway Park. It's also convenient for meeting up with a particular trolley tour that I took that stops in front of Fenway Park and lets you board at any stop. My hotel room on the second floor (top floor) had a peek-a-boo view of Fenway Park and faced out onto the hotel courtyard where there was an outdoor swimming pool. Pro#2: Great service. First example- I had a package delivered to the hotel. I thought it was going to be delivered during my stay at the hotel, but the package arrived a few days prior to my arrival. I called the hotel and was delighted when the lady at the desk said they would hold it until I arrived, no problem. Sure enough, when I checked in, they had it ready for me. Second example- I checked out early in the morning and was waiting in the lobby for an airport shuttle. When I had been waiting a while, the two men on duty offered to call the shuttle for me. When they couldn't get ahold of the shuttle, they offered to call me a taxi. The taxi pulled up a minute later. Third example- The cleaning service restocked the toiletries. (I stayed multiple nights.) It's something I took for granted until I stayed in a hotel that didn't! Con#1: No breakfast offered in the hotel. In the Fenway Park neighborhood, there are lots of bars and lunch/dinner restaurants but no coffee shops or other places that serve breakfast (that I could find). I would've even paid for breakfast if the hotel had offered it. (The restaurant inside the hotel is Hong Kong Cafe, a Chinese restaurant that is open for lunch and dinner.) It looked like there used to be a McDonalds across the street from the hotel but it was no longer in business. Con#2: Older hotel Because this is an older hotel, there were a few problems. I couldn't adjust the temperature in my room. It was freezing cold inside the room the first two nights when it was cold outside, and stuffy when it was warmer outside on my last night. Along with that, there was no way to turn the fan on in the bathroom. Also, the room smelled faintly of cigarette smoke. The hotel is now 100% non-smoking, but until they replace the carpets, freshen up the paint inside the room, etc, it will always smell. To be fair, they are in the process of refurbishing the hotel. They were painting the halls when I was there. I didn't have any trouble sleeping because of noise. Sure, I could hear people in the hall, faucets, the soundcheck at the concert across the street at Fenway Park. But maybe I am more used to noise than others since I live in an apartment building. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel with great service very close to Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: NomadForLife
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if I just got a crap room or what, but some of the reviews describe a much nicer hotel than what I stayed in. The good: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Literally across the street from Fenway, can't beat it. Also, the staff is super friendly/helpful and the rooms are (dated but) clean. There is a restaurant attached that serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and it is reasonably priced. The bad: I realize this is not the hotel's fault, but our room was on the second floor facing the park. I requested a "room with a view" and while the view of Fenway was fantastic, it was NOISY. Each night after the game around midnight the cleaning crew and their equipment could be heard as well as early AM deliveries. It made sleeping difficult. The inside of the hotel is a bit noisy as well, you can hear toilet's flush, doors open, etc. Then there were "little things" like, the WI-FI working one day but not the next (they do have a 24 hr service number to call and they were very nice and helpful). And NESN? We were told they didn't get it, so I'm curious as to how the other customers got it on their TVs. The parking situation concerns me, I wish they had better supervision. There is no security and I looked out the window one night to find a man on a bicycle riding around the lot looking into people's cars. There is also no elevator. Let me say, I am 28 but I was traveling with my two senior parents. I booked the hotel at the "Senior Rate", which is deeply discounted, so I'm wondering if they assign less desirable rooms to those rates. Overall the hotel is good enough to crash for a night after the game and if I were traveling alone for just a night, I would stay again. However, it is not comfortable enough for another extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Any closer and you'd be in the dugout !”
Reviews.Author: Crazy2Ski
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise to open the drapes and practically reach out and touch one of baseball's true gems. Not only is the hotel close to Fenway, but if you want to go downtown, the MBTA Green Line is a couple of blocks away in Kenmore Square. Once I parked my car, I never needed it until it was time to leave. The hotel looks like an older property, and has a '60's look to the lobby. Nothing elaborate however the room was a standard hotel room. Nothing overly fancy, but everything was clean and in very good shape. For the value you could not go wrong. Check in was quick, and the staff more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get closer to Fenway than this!”
Reviews.Author: FenwayFanFlorida
Reviews.Content: Great location! It is as close to Fenway as you can get. Good value for the money. We plan on staying at the hotel on our next Fenway visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay for Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: tsarnick3
Reviews.Content: This is a baseball fan's dream hotel. From our 2nd floor room we could see (and hear) Fenway Park ...the back of the right field seats, the signs, etc. Pahk the cah and forget about it because it's a 2 minute walk to the games. Our room was very clean and comfortable (the bedspread was very colorful to say the least); it was also surprisingly quiet even tho the hotel was packed the 1st 3 nights we stayed. Didn't try the Chinese restaurant but made it to the hotel Tiki bar every night.... highly reasonable prices ($3 for a 16 ounce can of beer, $5 or 6 for a mixed drink....friendly if a little rowdy at times. All in all a great value. About a 7 minute walk to the nearest subway stop (Kenmore).

Reviews.Title: “Open Day Game along to Aquarium with Kids - no car needed”
Reviews.Author: Fancy_9
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk to Fenway Park and enjoy all festivities that go along with Red Sox Opening Day Game. Did not have to pay for parking which is very steep since we were staying at the hotel. Open Day was canceled because of weather , no problem , Howard Johnson's was able to accommodate us for another night. The adults enjoyed the day at the many pubs in Boston. The next day we were able to take the "T" to the Aquarium with the children since the rescheduled game did not start until 4:00 p.m. We got back in time to see a great win by the Sox and had some night life while the younger adults and children went back to Howard Johnson's and ate a delicious Chineese meal. ALL THIS WAS DONE WITH TWO HANDICAPPED PEOPLE. The staff was great!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kmscy
Reviews.Content: I had to get some testing done at Brigham and Womans and the hospital said that this hotel does hospital rates with proof. I stayed with my daughter and we were very happy with everything here. The room was large and clean. Close to the hospital and very close to Fenway and some great places to eat. The room has a fridge, always a plus. There is also a chinese place in the hotel with great food and a lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for runners of Boston Marathon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Feredia
Reviews.Content: Excellento location, everything was clean, and just what you need if you are running Boston marathon. Within 10 blocks of everything and an excellento cost for 2-3 runners splitting the room rate. Thumbs upppppppppppppppp!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Courteous Staff, Cleanliness & Location”
Reviews.Author: Tammy_Ooku
Reviews.Content: Needed an affordable location that was also centrally located. This hotel provided this and more. The facilities were clean and the staff very courteous. Also the shuttle service provided by the hotel to the hospital was very convenient. During our trip my mom inadvertently misplaced a personal item. We called the hotel and they sent it in the mail ASAP. This was very commendable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Halifax_19
Reviews.Content: Number 1 location in Boston for those visiting to see Redsox. Have been staying here for years and have been impressed with improvements in cleanliness/ambience of rooms and helpfulness of staff. Adjacent to Fenway Park yet minutes from Downtown by cab or train. Great value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful: Highly Reccommend”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyGardenGirl
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel and its staff! My family and I spent three weeks there in November, while I was recuperating from hip surgery at Boston Childrenâ€™s Hospital. Needless to say it was an extremely stressful period for my family; the staff went above and beyond to make us as comfortable as possible. I was in the hospital for a week, but family stayed in the hotel. I will be honest, it is an older hotel; however it was being renovated during our stay. We stayed the first two nights in a regular room because we had not thought to make prior arrangements for a handicap accessible room. The room was on the smaller end, but was comfortable. It also had a refrigerator and microwave. The staff was able to move us to a handicap accessible room after the second night. This room also had a refrigerator and microwave both of which were useful during our extended stay. The hotel has complimentary transportation to and from the hospitals. I had complications from surgery and had to return to see the doctor. The van was unavailable this time so the manger not only called us a cab, but he even paid for the trip. The best part of the hotel is the staff. They went above and beyond. Every time someone from my family returned to the hotel the staff would ask about how I was doing. The housekeeping staff was always mindful of my condition and cleaned the room as quickly as possible. The van driver always friendly and helpful. Since I was recovering from surgery I was slow getting in and out of the van. However, the driver was patient and tried to help in any way possible. By the time we left, we had come to think of the staff as family. Without reservation, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right at Fenway”
Reviews.Author: khadley1
Reviews.Content: Needed an affordable hotel near Fenway/Back Bay to pick-up one son from Berklee College of Music and visit Northeastern University with another son. This HoJo fit the bill perfectly. The room was clean and comfortable, the cost was very reasonable especially for Boston, the location was perfect, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hojos”
Reviews.Author: esulkowski
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. We experienced a problem with our refrigerator, they gave us a new refrigerator in no time. I was given great directions and advise during our trip. I would definitely visit this location and would tell my friends and family about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with genuine customer service”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMaine
Reviews.Content: I was immediately pleased with the genuine friendliness and graciousness of the front desk attendent upon check-in. My family had a few special requests (to keep our car a few hours longer in the lot after check-out, an extra cot, extra towels, etc..) and each request was acted upon quickly and with an attitude of friendliness. The housekeeping staff was also friendly and attentive, and each time I had a need or question about the area the front desk attendent was very helpful (even looking up for me where in the area I could get my favorite coffee). I found it to be comfortable and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break ( 3 nights ) - will be back.”
Reviews.Author: DeargDoom
Reviews.Content: To Summarise - 1) a very good welcome on check-in (thanks Beverly and Anthony). And indeed, no hassle getting my boarding pass printed prior to departure (cheers Lisa), 2) superb housekeeping (including 2 bottles of spring water left daily - most appreciated - thank you), 3) a nice walk to the Prudential Centre etc., 4) excellent Chinese Restaurant onsite - there are also fast food / pizza options just across the road, with Shaws Supermarket a 3-minute walk away (turn right as you exit hotel), 5) a nifty lounge (to the left of reception) - alas no draught beers, 6) not alone did the room have a fridge & microwave, but also a DVD/Video unit (channel 00 on the remote, folks) - GREAT idea ( I did indeed use the DVD to check out some discs purchased in the 'Best Buy' store, also on Boylston Street ), 7) Sometimes there IS a (pleasant) aroma from the Restaurant downstairs, but only noticable in the hallway, not in the room itself. mmmm - nice. 8) ok - so some of the furniture looks a tad worn but so what ? You can store your stuff in the drawers etc. and isn't that the important thing ? 9) and of course, it's nice to be able to stash your luggage for a few hours post check-out but prior to the airtport-dash. Overall, I recommend the HoJo. Anytime. ( Useful tip - the cab-driver didn't appear to know where HoJo Boylston was, until I specifically mentioned Fenway ).

Reviews.Title: “great location for red soxs fans,will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: b_radCanada
Reviews.Content: loved the local,everything needed within 2 blocks and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “You Got To Love Howard Johnson at Fenway”
Reviews.Author: joaovasco
Reviews.Content: Last month we went to a Red Sox / Yankees game at Fenway Park. We got the tickets early in ther season and planned to make a weekend out of. With a little research we found Howard Johnson Inn at Fenway Park and it didn't disappoint. It 's reasonably priced and is right behind Fenway, (just a 5 minute walk to Fenway). Even though normal check-in isn't until 2 PM we got there an hour and a half early (just to park in there lot), we were able to check-in. We stayed in room 222, which if you looked out the window you could see Fenway Park. Actually any even numbered room will have a great view of Fenway Park. (Rooms 218, 220, 222 have probably the best view of the players parking garage area on Van Ness St). The front desk staff was great, they had a lot of local knowledge and gave us some suggestions on things to do. It was too cold to go swimming but, they do have an outdoor pool. It's close to many restuarants and bars such as Boston Beer works, Cask and Flagon, etc. It's also next to many T-stations including Kenmore Square (about 15 minute walk). Its not the most luxurious hotel in Boston however it was a great stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Fenway!”
Reviews.Author: babybou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a night of a Red Sox Game. It was perfect for what we were looking for. Nothing beats the location if one is going to the game. The parking at the hotel is priced well for the area and once the car was parked, there was nothing to worry about! We had a very positive experience. We arrived a bit earlier than normal check in time and were given a room straight away. We could leave our stuff and freshen up before our afternoon of sightseeing. The room itself was comfortable and clean. Bed was big and comfy after a long day of walking around and catching the game. Bathroom facilities were fine as well. The shower had good water pressure. Can't beat the value for money for the location. Would stay again at this Howard Johnson's without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: crwrlw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times and I always find it a great place. The location is excellant and the rooms are always very clean. The staff is courteous and helpful. You simply cann't find a better place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Chipsue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to Boston for the Red Sox game and a little sightseeing. We had been to The Red Sox before and stayed at different hotels. Someone told us about Howard Johnson by the Fenway, so I got on the computer and booked a couple of nights We got there early in the afternoon and had no problem checking in early .Thet directed us to a number of restaraunts in walking distance and answered all our questions. We got to our room and were very happy with it. It was very clean and spacious. It was in walking distance of Fenway Park and close to all public transportation.It had a lounge and restaraunt right in the building. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: keysmank
Reviews.Content: Putting our kid into college, HJ was the cheapest accomodations at $127/night. Staff was more interested in their personal conversations than attending customers,offered forgotten personal items on a in room card but request to the front desk didn't result in the items being placed in the room and a request at the desk resulted in an admission that they didn't have any. Parking was $20/night but was only displayed on a small card and they don't inform the customer upon arrival. Staff is surly and will not give their names. Probably illegals. Stay only if no other choice and I can recommend the restaurant food and service which were the exact opposite of the rest of the place. Consider it a liitle better than hotels you rent by the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: boule
Reviews.Content: Room was small, service can be with more smiles, location was great. No breakfast, fee for parking. It was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: MerrySox
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the HoJo Fenway Park hotel was unbelievable. As huge Red Sox fans, my girlfriend and I had been looking forward to our trip for months. Because the hotel is located directly beside Fenway Park, it seemed like an obvious place to stay. We weren't disappointed. The room was very clean and was kept that way by the excellent housekeeping staff. The people at the front desk were extremely helpful, going as far as walking outside with us to the sidewalk and giving us very precise directions to a number of excellent restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The in-hotel restaurant featured great food at great prices; we highly recommend the "All-American Breakfast." All in all, our time spent at the Howard Johnson Fenway Hotel in Boston was a very enjoyable one. We plan on visiting Boston again in the future and will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “HoJo's - Best Hotel in Bosotn!”
Reviews.Author: jyates17
Reviews.Content: My family andI have been traveling to Boston my whole life and the "HoJo's" is our favorite place to stay. We have stayed in other hotels and none are as wonderful as the Howard Johnson at Fenway. We just can't get enough. We love EVERYTHING about it. The customer service you receive there is wonderful. No matter when we go, and we go several times a year, the staff is always so pleasant and friendly. The life guard at the pool is great, the maids that clean the room are great, all the way to the staff at the restaraunt downstairs. I would recommend HoJo's to anyone that is going to stay in Boston. You get a welcoming, family oriented atmosphere that makes being away from home relaxing. I just love that place and can't wait to go back in October.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: dee2769
Reviews.Content: It was a great location especially how close you are to Fenway Park. It also has great restaurants across the street. Everything you need is very close to the hotel. The room was also nice and clean and a good size. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: karsus9
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Boston on short notice, and was quite pleased to find this establishment. Located near convenient T stops and Fenway Park, it was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent, and I couldn't have asked for a sounder night's sleep. To top it off, the price was far better than other exorbitant fees in the area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Sox Fans But Quality Issues”
Reviews.Author: StandingRoom
Reviews.Content: Ok, if youâ€™re traveling to Boston with "the guys" to attending a Sox game, this is a great spot since it is located directly adjacent to Fenway Park (many rooms have a Fenway view)! Now if you're heading to Boston with your family and not willing to sacrifice cleanliness to sleep next to Fenway, you may find this spot a little "worn" and over-prices as a result. I have traveled to this hotel every year since 2003 and have watched prices increase only to see no renovations to rooms or facilities. Many rooms smell of must and mold, which may not a concern when vacationing with the sports team or guys! The hotel is close to Kenmore Square, with Kenmore MBTA station, Dunkin Donuts, Popeyeâ€™s, McDonalds, ect. (5-10 minutes walk) There is a McDonalds and several drug stores located next to the hotel with a Burger King and Shawâ€™s Grocery store to the west of the hotel. There is a great night life on Lansdowne Street, a few minutes from the hotel. This hotel needs major renovations (we've seen stains in 2003 that are still present) or need to be rebuilt (which may be in the plans)! If the price was on par with the quality one might not real to bad about staying here but there are other hotel options in BackBay/Downtown for a similar price and high quality. As mentioned in other reviews, the staffs at this hotel are wonderful; it is a shame that the product is not the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ABSOXFAN
Reviews.Content: With the proximity to Fenway Park, it's an excellent place to stay if you're catching a Red Sox game, plus it's only a 10 minute walk to downtown. Not only that, the staff are absolutely fabulous! After numerous stays at this hotel, there is nothing that I can complain about. Compared to other major city hotels, the price is more than reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to crash for a redsox game”
Reviews.Author: biztravelerelvis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a bunch of guys for a bachelor party. Perfect! Fenway right next door. Great hotel bar. The bartender Mary Beth is awesome. If you need a place that is reasonable and don't expect much else it's perfect.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Inn Fenway Park Boston
HotelInfo.Address: 1271 Boylston Street, Boston, MA 02215
